content:
#!/bin/bash

module load java/1.8.0_20 python/3.5.1 gcc/4.8.2


# pre-IDS: lots of leeway
cfg1a="-nogui -g:0 -h:3 -w:3 -k:3 -t:5000 -b:5000"
cfg2a="-nogui -g:1 -h:6 -w:7 -k:4 -t:5000 -b:5000"
cfg3a="-nogui -g:0 -h:9 -w:7 -k:4 -t:5000 -b:5000"
# IDS versions: timeout matters
cfg1b="-nogui -g:0 -h:3 -w:3 -k:3 -t:5000 -b:500"
cfg2b="-nogui -g:1 -h:6 -w:7 -k:4 -t:5000 -b:500"
cfg3b="-nogui -g:0 -h:9 -w:7 -k:4 -t:5000 -b:500"

# Brute force version using ulimit?
#ati/run_limit java -jar ConnectK_1.8.jar -nogui py:ati/src/RandomAI.py py:$ai  2>&1| grep -e Winner -e Exception -e Killed || printf "\n"


# ['g++', '-I.', '-o', team_name + 'byTA', '--static' -std=c++11


for dir in Submissions/${1}_*/* ; do
  echo $dir
  for ai in $dir/*/src/*AI.py ; do
    [ -f "$ai" ] || continue
    echo "  Type python"
    echo -n "  Testing makes move:  "
    python3 $bin$ai < boards/0.txt 2>&1| grep -e ReturningThe || printf "\n"
    echo -n "  vs RandomAI: "
    java -jar ConnectK_1.8_timer_enabled.jar $cfg1a  py:ati/src/TestRandomAI.py py:$ai  2>&1| grep -e Winner -e Exception -e Killed || printf "\n"
  done
  for ai in $dir/*/bin/*AI.class ; do
    [ -f "$ai" ] || continue
    echo "  Type java/class"
    echo -n "  vs RandomAI: "
    java -jar ConnectK_1.8.jar $cfg1a py:ati/src/TestRandomAI.py ${ai%.*}  2>&1| grep -e Winner -e Exception -e Killed || printf "\n"
  done
  #for ai in $dir/*/bin/*AI ; do
  for ai in $dir/*/bin/byAlex ; do
    [ -f "$ai" ] || continue
    echo "  Type cpp bin"
    echo -n "  Testing makes move: "
    $ai < boards/0.txt 2>&1| grep -e ReturningThe || printf "\n"
    echo -n "  vs RandomAI: "
    java -jar ConnectK_1.8.jar $cfg1a py:ati/src/TestRandomAI.py cpp:$ai  2>&1| grep -e Winner -e Exception -e Killed || printf "\n"
  done
  echo
  echo "======================================================================================="
  echo
done
